DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluates the effects of different volumes of aerobic exercise training in cardiovascular parameters of patients with cardiovascular diseases enrolled in a cardiac rehabilitation program.
DOC.brief_title: The Effects of Aerobic Exercise in Microvascular Endothelium Function in Patients With Cardiovascular Diseases
DOC.detailed_description: Aerobic exercise training is well known to improve endothelium dependent vasodilatation in the microcirculation. However, the impact of exercise frequency on this response in patients with coronary artery disease remains unclear.
DOC.criteria: sedentarism for at least 6 months; clinical diagnosis for coronary artery disease (occurrence of any acute coronary syndrome, including ST elevation or nonST elevation myocardial infarction or unstable angina or by the diagnosis of obstructive coronary artery disease on coronary angiography in patients with stable angina). nephropathies; decompensated cardiovascular diseases; liver diseases.
